entries.title: VX methodology for GitHub profile evaluation
entries.summary: Bilal developing VX (Values Experience) methodology into practical tool for Claude Code to audit GitHub profiles. VX traces Values → Affordances → UX → UI → Code to check if implementation helps/hinders users living by their values. Uses Joe Edelman's Constitutive Attentional Policies (CAPs) framework. Created working prompt for Claude Code.

cap_identified.description: Values-driven design methodology - ensuring technical implementations align with human values
cap_identified.manifestation: Creating systematic framework to audit if code serves what matters to users
cap_identified.attention_policy: ALIGNMENT between what people find meaningful and how systems are built

key_quotes: I want to develop a methodology called VX which starts with the persons values and ways they want to be and to see if our affordances which lead to ux and then ui and then code help that or hinder that
The question isn't 'is this good code?' but 'does this help you live and work in a way that feels meaningful to you?'

methodology_details.inspiration: Research showing LLM impersonating user can give high quality purchase decision probabilities
methodology_details.application: Infer values from GitHub artifacts (project choices, code comments, trade-offs), then trace alignment through layers
methodology_details.example_case: ChatGPT for teachers - reveals tensions between convenience (instant answers) vs pedagogical values (productive struggle)

entries.title: Al-Kindi al-Farabi contributions to Islamic psychology
entries.summary: Short academic research question about Al-Kindi and Al-Farabi's contributions to Islamic psychology. Al-Kindi: first Muslim philosopher, cognitive therapy for sorrow (aligning heart with what is lasting/God). Al-Farabi: soul faculties model, imagination and prophecy, virtuous city. Shows Bilal's intellectual foundation for Islamic practices + tech integration work.

key_concepts_learned.Al-Farabi: Soul faculties (appetitive, sensory, imaginative, rational), imagination as mediator for prophecy, virtuous city (society mirrors soul)

entries.title: Business name ideas - leaving Bloom, starting new org
entries.summary: CRITICAL DISCOVERY: Bilal is starting a new organization after leaving Bloom. Was brainstorming names for next stage after 'Bloom' (growth). Focus: self-sustaining communities with ROSCA-inspired mutual aid (jam'iyya, susu, esusu). Ubuntu philosophy: 'we ARE stronger and we GO farther when we go together.' Exploring names: Gather Commons, Overstory Commons, Harvest Commons, Rootweave Collective. Concept: 'harvesting the goodwill/effort/time Bloom has invested.'
key_quotes: I have a business called bloom implying growth and development from seeds. I want to show what comes next
we were supporting social enterprises with grant money and now we want to create self sustaining communities
I need to stop using the word Bloom, because I'm leaving my co-founder and I'm starting something new
moving from we provide support to WE provide support, financial, emotional, relationships and connections, intellectual, skills, mentorship etc TO each other
we ARE stronger and we GO farther when we go together
harvesting the goodwill/effort/time Bloom has invested with all the teams

entries.title: Community support app design - Wellbeing Project Ecosystem
entries.summary: 84-message voice conversation about designing community support app for Wellbeing Project Ecosystem (Aaron Hurst). Problem: People asking main team members for therapist/practitioner recommendations, connections. Solution: Vetted directory/registry that people access when they have needs, not forced platform use. Design challenges: How to get people to fill it out? What to gather? Integration into onboarding/yearly check-in. Also mentions Global Innovation Gathering network.

entries.title: UNICEF Office of Innovation - Learning & Development facilitator job application
entries.summary: 73-message conversation applying to UNICEF Office of Innovation for learning & development facilitator role. Bilal asks ChatGPT to review his entire chat history for facilitation style, ways of being, hosting approaches. 10 questions asked about non-negotiable principles, signature ways of creating safety, learning design approach ('lightweight but deep'), Come Alive/attentional principles integration, motivation for UNICEF role.

job_details.documents: ToR (Terms of Reference) attached to conversation

key_themes_from_questions: Structured interviews, asset mapping, identifying tensions in first 2-3 weeks
Come Alive, attentional principles, beauty as a guide, learning as meaning-making
bilal_facilitation_approach.philosophical_grounding: Question 10 asks if Come Alive/attentional principles should be explicit or stay implicit - shows tension between deep theory and professional positioning

key_quotes: I'm applying to a new job and I'd like your help. I'm attaching the ToR documents here and I'd like you to review my entire history with you for insights/ways of being/ways I like to host and facilitate
